remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)] 這個類別用於表示 的子活動清單。This class is used to represent the list of child activities for a . > [!NOTE] > 請只呼叫衍生自 而非 的方法，例如使用 來加入活動而非 。Only call methods derived from and not , such as using to add activities instead of . 呼叫衍生自 的方法會產生非預期的結果。Calling methods derived from will have unexpected consequences. ## Examples 下列範例顯示存取 ，它是包含所有子活動的複合活動類別的成員。The following example shows access of the which is the member of a composite activity class containing all child activities. 這個程式碼範例是 ThrowWorkflow.cs 檔案中＜使用擲回 SDK 範例＞的一部分。This code example is part of the Using Throw SDK Sample and is from the ThrowWorkflow.cs file. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 < [ 使用 ThrowActivity 活動](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/82bc0fef-d78a-4750-82b4-e4cb397a10f1)。For more information, see [Using the ThrowActivity Activity](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/82bc0fef-d78a-4750-82b4-e4cb397a10f1). MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> GetEnumerator() cil managed
Public Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator(Of Activity)

summary.span: 實作 的列舉介面。

span.span: Implements an enumeration interface to the .

returns.span: 傳回可以逐一查看 執行個體的列舉值。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 列舉值只能夠讀取集合中的資料。Enumerators only enable reading the data in the collection. 您無法使用列舉值修改基礎集合。You cannot use enumerators to modify the underlying collection. 一開始，列舉值是位於集合中的第一個項目之前。To begin, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也會將列舉值帶回至這個位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在這個位置上，呼叫 會引發例回狀況。At this position, calling raises an exception. 因此，在讀取 的值之前，必須呼叫 以將列舉值前移至集合的第一個項目。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 會傳回相同的物件直到呼叫 或 。 returns the same object until either or is called. 會將 設定為下一個項目。 sets to the next element. 在超過集合的末端後，列舉值會放置在集合最後一個元素之後，並且呼叫 會傳回 `false`。After the end of the collection is passed, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection, and calling returns `false`. 如果上一次的 呼叫傳回 `false`，則呼叫 會引發例外狀況。If the last call to returned `false`, calling raises an exception. 若要再次將 `Current` 設定為集合的第一個元素，您可以在呼叫 `Reset` 之後，接著呼叫 。To set `Current` to the first element of the collection again, you can call `Reset` followed by . 只要集合維持不變，列舉程式就持續有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果集合有任何變更，例如加入、修改或刪除元素，列舉值將失效而無法復原，而且下次呼叫 或 `Reset` 時，將引發 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the enumerator is irreversibly invalidated and the next call to or `Reset` raises an . 如果在 和 之間修改集合， 將傳回所設定的元素，即使列舉值已經無效。If the collection is modified between and , will return the element that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated. 列舉程式沒有集合的獨佔存取權，因此，列舉集合內容本質上並不是安全的執行緒程序。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使當集合同步化時，其他執行緒仍然可以修改集合。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection. 這會造成列舉值引發例外狀況。This causes the enumerator to raise an exception. 若要保證列舉過程的執行緒安全，您可以在整個列舉過程中鎖定集合，或攔截由其他執行緒的變更所造成的例外狀況。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在這個環境下，新增或移除成員會引發事件。In this context, adding or removing members raises the event. 修改成員不會引發這個事件。Modifying a member does not raise this event. 當您建立 委派 (Delegate) 時，就可以識別即將處理此事件的方法。When you create an delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. 若要使事件與您的事件處理常式產生關聯，請將委派的執行個體 (Instance) 加入至事件。To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. 除非您移除委派，否則每當事件發生時就會呼叫事件處理常式。The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. 如需有關事件處理常式委派的詳細資訊，請參閱[處理和引發事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 實作依判斷物件相等的方法會有所不同；例如， 使用 ，而 則讓使用者指定要用來比較索引鍵的 實作。Implementations can vary in how they determine equality of objects; for example, uses , whereas, allows the user to specify the implementation to use for comparing keys. 在相鄰元素的集合中，例如清單，接在移除的元素之後的元素會向上移動以佔用空出的位置。In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. 如果集合具有索引，則移動之項目的索引也會更新。If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. 集合的項目若在概念上群組成 Bucket (例如雜湊資料表)，則不適用這項行為。This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.

span.span: The is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.GetEnumerator() cil managed
Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator(Of Activity) Implements IEnumerable(Of Activity).GetEnumerator

summary.span: 傳回逐一查看集合的列舉值。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
An that can be used to iterate through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 語言的陳述式 (`for each` c + + `For Each` Visual Basic 中) 會隱藏列舉值的複雜度。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建議您使用 `foreach`，而不要直接使用列舉值。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 列舉程式可以用來讀取集合中的資料，但是無法用來修改基礎集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 一開始，列舉程式位在集合中的第一個項目之前。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在這個位置上， 並未定義。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在讀取 的值之前，必須呼叫 以將列舉值前移至集合的第一個項目。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 會傳回相同的物件直到呼叫 。 returns the same object until is called. 會將 設定為下一個項目。 sets to the next element. 如果 超過集合結尾，列舉值會位於集合的最後一個項目之後，同時 會傳回 false。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns false. 當列舉值位於這個位置時，對 的後續呼叫也會傳回 false。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return false. 如果上一次呼叫 傳回 false，則 並未定義。If the last call to returned false, is undefined. 您不能再次將 設定為集合的第一個項目；您必須建立新的列舉值執行個體。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合維持不變，列舉程式就持續有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果對集合進行變更，例如加入、修改或刪除項目，列舉程式會永久失效，且其行為未定義。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 列舉程式沒有集合的獨佔存取權，因此，列舉集合內容本質上並不是安全的執行緒程序。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要確保列舉期間的執行緒安全性，您可以在整個列舉期間鎖定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要讓多重執行緒能夠存取集合以便進行讀取和寫入，您必須實作自己的同步處理。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空間中集合的預設實作未同步處理。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.IndexOf(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity item) cil managed

param.name: item
param.span: 要在 中尋找的物件。

returns.span: 如果可在清單中找到則為 的索引，否則為 -1。

span.span: The index of if found in the list; otherwise, -1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果物件在清單中多次出現，則 `IndexOf` 方法一定會傳回找到的第一個執行個體。If an object occurs multiple times in the list, the `IndexOf` method always returns the first instance found.

C# 語言使用 `this` 關鍵字定義索引，而不必實作 `Item` 屬性。The C# language uses the `this` keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the `Item` property. Visual Basic 會將 `Item` 實作為預設屬性，這樣會提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements `Item` as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在相鄰元素的集合中，例如清單，接在移除的元素之後的元素會向上移動以佔用空出的位置。In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. 如果集合具有索引，則移動之項目的索引也會更新。If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. 集合的項目若在概念上群組成 Bucket (例如雜湊資料表)，則不適用這項行為。This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean Implements ICollection.IsSynchronized

summary.span: 取得值，指出 的存取是否同步，亦即是否執行緒安全。

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether access to the is synchronized, that is thread-safe.

value.span: 如果是同步存取 (也就是執行緒安全)，則為 ，否則為 。

span.span: if access to the is synchronized, that is, thread-safe; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 會傳回物件，該物件可用來同步處理對 的存取。 returns an object, which can be used to synchronize access to the . 在 命名空間中大部分的集合類別也實作 `Synchronized` 方法，這會提供基礎集合周圍同步處理的包裝函式。Most collection classes in the namespace also implement a `Synchronized` method, which provides a synchronized wrapper around the underlying collection. 透過集合進行列舉在本質上並非安全執行緒程序。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使集合經過同步化，其他的執行緒仍可修改該集合，使列舉值擲回例外狀況。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要保證列舉過程的執行緒安全，您可以在整個列舉過程中鎖定集合，或攔截由其他執行緒的變更所造成的例外狀況。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property SyncRoot As Object Implements ICollection.SyncRoot

summary.span: 取得可用以同步存取 的物件。

span.span: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

value.span: 可用以同步存取 的物件。

span.span: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 對於那些無法公開使用基礎存放區的集合而言，所預期的實作會傳回目前的執行個體。For collections whose underlying store is not publicly available, the expected implementation is to return the current instance. 請注意，目前執行個體的指標對於包裝其他集合的集合而言可能不足；這些集合應該傳回基礎集合 屬性。Note that the pointer to the current instance might not be sufficient for collections that wrap other collections; those should return the underlying collection property. 在 命名空間中大部分的集合類別也實作 `Synchronized` 方法，這會提供基礎集合周圍同步處理的包裝函式。Most collection classes in the namespace also implement a `Synchronized` method, which provides a synchronized wrapper around the underlying collection. 然而，衍生類別 (Derived Class) 可以使用 屬性，提供它們自己集合的同步化版本。However, derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the collection using the property. 必須在集合的 屬性上執行同步處理程式碼的作業，而不是直接在集合上執行。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the property of the collection, not directly on the collection. 如此可確保衍生自其他物件的集合可以正常運作，This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 特別是可以與其他可能同時修改集合執行個體的執行緒，保持正常的同步處理。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the collection instance.
